docs.lead_paragraph: The chief executive of troubled reinsurer Swiss Re, Jacques Aigrain, is stepping down a week after U.S. investor Warren E. Buffett stepped in with new capital and the group reported a big loss.

headline.main: Swiss Re's Chief Resigns In Surprise Move

docs.abstract: The chief executive of troubled reinsurer Swiss Re, Jacques Aigrain, is stepping down a week after U.S. investor Warren E. Buffett stepped in with new capital and the group reported a big loss. The world's second biggest reinsurer said deputy chief executive Stefan Lippe has been appointed to replace Mr. Aigrain, Reuters reported. "Having taken [...]

byline.contributor: Robert Pear, Kate Phillips and Jeff Zeleny contributed reporting.
byline.original: By DAVID M. HERSZENHORN and CARL HULSE

docs.lead_paragraph: Establishing a four-day, 36-hour work week for some 40,000 municipal employees could save New York City $32.6 million next year. Deferring health insurance coverage for new city employees until they worked for three months would save $45 million each year. And reducing the Medicare Part B reimbursements for city retirees to 50 percent from 100 percent would save the city $93.5 million in 2011.

headline.main: Ideas to Save the City Millions

docs.abstract: The Independent Budget Office's annual "Budget Options" report is full of ideas for saving money. But many of them would be politically difficult to achieve.
